intro: Ixeridium, commonly known as the grass tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Poaceae. These plants are native to Australia and are characterized by their tall, grass-like foliage and distinctive flowering spikes. Ixeridium species typically have fibrous roots and produce small, wind-pollinated flowers that can range in color from white to pink. The genus includes several species, such as Ixeridium spicatum, which is often found in coastal and sandy environments. Ixeridium plants are adapted to arid conditions and can thrive in well-drained soils.
